title: How far away was the first ever photographed black hole? - Quora

response.answer_text: 55 million light years. A light year is the distance light will travel in a year - its a distance, not a time. Light travels about 180,000 miles per second. Multiply by the number of seconds in a year .. 60 * 60 * 24 * 365 = 31.5 million So a light year is 5.6 trillion miles - so the black hole is 312 million trillion miles away. And the light will have taken 55 million years to reach us. We see the object as it was 55 million years ago.
M87 is 55 million light years away, and it is the first and only black hole that has assimilated a photographic image from radio data of 8 radio telescopes across the Earth.

They did not take a photograph. They sampled light and constructed a very very very rough approximation of what they thought they could see. That kind of “research” is wishful thinking at best and total academic dishonesty at worst. We have been seeing an increasing amount of this in recent years.
